subject: assertThat problem
msgSnippet: When trying to experimentally translate a couple of tests to JUnit 4.4 assertThat syntax, I m running into a problem: How would you translate
messageBody:
When trying to experimentally translate a couple of tests to JUnit 4.4
assertThat syntax, I'm running into a problem:

How would you translate

assertFalse(myObject.equals(null))

so that "myObject.equals(null)" will be called on test execution.

assertThat(null, not(eq(myObject)))
and
assertThat(myObject, not(eq(null)))

don't seem to execute "myObject.equals(null)" due to some hamcrest magic.

But maybe I'm just being dumb...

Johannes

PS: It's also strange (ie. unexpected behaviour) that
assertThat(new Object(), not(eq(myObject))
does not compile but I have to add a cast to myObject.
